before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"cb685","text":"Samples should be fragmented double-stranded DNA.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cch40","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4m8ol","text":"Samples should be dissolved in molecular biology grade water or standard buffer solution such as Tris or TE. See Effects of Common Laboratory Reagents on Size Selection at end of user guide for more information.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3l74t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dti1u","text":"Sample volume should be ≥ 50 μL. A lower volume will decrease pipetting accuracy of SPRIselect, therefore increasing selection point variability.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pao6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3916f","text":"DNA fragments may be size selected in a range no smaller than 150 bp and no larger than 800 bp.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65gup","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q7gv","text":"To maximize recovery for a Left Side Size Selection, the majority of the sample’s size distribution should be larger than the selection point.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvd86","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45rs0","text":"To maximize recovery for a Right Side Size Selection, the majority of the sample’s size distribution should be smaller than the selection point.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5duhg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mvu0","text":"To maximize recovery for a Double Size Selection, the size distribution should be centered between the selection points.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ag0c","text":"SPRIselect is a SPRI-based chemistry that speeds and simplifies nucleic acid size selection for fragment library preparation for Next Generation sequencing. In this process, size selection is required to produce a uniform distribution of fragments around an average size. Using SPRIselect, the size distribution can be adjusted to suit the application and platform used. The process can be scaled for low to high throughput workflows.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63t6u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8hf2","text":"The guidance provided below can be used to optimize the desired size selection range. Used manually or automated on a liquid handling system such as the Biomek Laboratory Automation Workstation, SPRIselect will provide rapid and consistent size selection suitable for most applications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"bbtnf","text":"Beckman Coulter makes no warranties of any kind whatsoever express or implied, with respect to the method, including but not limited to warranties of fitness for a particular purpose or merchantability or that the method is non-infringing. All other warranties are expressly disclaimed. Your use of the method is solely at your own risk, without recourse to Beckman Coulter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"fur9j","text":"Reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ujmn","text":"1 x Bottle of SPRI Beads","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ebrb","text":"1x Bottle of Elution Buffer (from extraction kit)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f6a0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhpf","text":"Supplies","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8s1g","text":"Sample or Pool (to be purified)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97ffs","text":"Extra 1.5mL Tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3n7b","text":"Magnetic Stand","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hmk3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dcbn","text":"Equipment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cjjo","text":"Serological pipette \u0026 10mL serological pipette tip","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rt93","text":"200uL pipette \u0026 tips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5c8i5","text":"20uL pipette \u0026 tips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"62oaa","text":"Make   80% Ethanol (200-proof) (make fresh each time). Gently shake the SPRI beads bottle to resuspend any magnetic particles that may have settled. Take aliquot into a tube for working solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9kir3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"65AD8760E1EE11EC90A50758A517DF45","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fhgg7","text":"Pipette PCR product (single or pooled) and transfer to single 0.2mL tube(s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ch9ul","text":"Add 1.2X the volume of SPRI beads to the samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"960jt","text":"Total volume of your sample or pool x 1.2 = required volume of SPRI beads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":3},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":44,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"h66j","text":"Mix reagent and PCR product thoroughly by pipette mixing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cfge5","text":"Incubate mixed samples for   at room temperature for maximum recovery. Making sure to tap gently every 2-3 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7uo8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22gk8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"495eb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t7ub","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"94611860E1EE11EC90A50758A517DF45","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2pjhm","text":"Note: This step binds PCR products 150bp or greater to the magnetic beads. The color of the mixture should appear homogenous after mixing.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2fhvq","text":"Place the tube onto the magnetic stand for   to separate beads from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1rhoe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffurn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eq7ts","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"9D0E5130E1EE11EC90A50758A517DF45","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"bs8jo","text":"Note: Wait for the solution to clear before proceeding to the next step. At this point, there will be a brown ring around the side of the tube. These are the SPRI beads containing the PCR product.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ei6rl","text":"Remove supernatant and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eg8f8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8g3ft","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9nqth","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"88fbh","text":"Note: This step must be performed while the tube(s) are situated on the magnetic stand. Do NOT disturb the cluster of separated magnetic beads. If beads are drawn out, leave a few microliters of supernatant behind.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"npqs","text":"Add   of 80% Ethanol to the 1.5mL tube on the stand and incubate for   at room temperature. Pipette off the ethanol and discard. Repeat for a total 2 washes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"14ta6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b47ac","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8efqd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"120","error":false,"guid":"AFEA80D0E1EE11EC90A50758A517DF45","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"B2DB8640E1EE11EC90A50758A517DF45","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":13,"offset":224,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"key":"23bkh","text":"Note: It is important to perform these steps with the tube(s) situated on the magnetic stand. Do NOT disturb the separated magnetic beads. Be sure to remove all of the ethanol from the bottom of the tube as it is known as a PCR inhibitor.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fcp3v","text":"Open the tube lid(s) to allow evaporation of excess ethanol  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":60,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mc93","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f202","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e148c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"BB0E5EF0E1EE11EC90A50758A517DF45","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dfqun","text":"Note: Take care not to over dry the beads (bead cluster appears cracked) as this will significantly decrease elution efficiency.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5vjdj","text":"Remove the tube(s) from the stand. Add   of elution buffer (from the extraction kit) and mix by pipetting. This will separate the beads from the PCR product.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"af4id","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1eura","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a30di","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5r2j6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"C3712140E1EE11EC90A50758A517DF45","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5igg","text":"Note: The liquid level needs to be high enough to contact the magnetic beads. A greater volume of elution buffer can be used but using a low volume might require extra mixing and may not fully elute the entire product. Elution is quite rapid, and it is not necessary for the beads to go back into solution for it to occur.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"71u8j","text":"Place the tube(s) back onto the magnetic stand for   to separate the beads from the solution. Transfer the eluent to a new tube. This contains the purified PCR product.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cnq32","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"C9697340E1EE11EC90A50758A517DF45","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

title: SPRI Bead Cleanup
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"1o4m4","text":"Do not attempt to perform any procedure before carefully reading all instructions. Always follow product labeling and manufacturer’s recommendations. If in doubt as to how to proceed in any situation, contact your Beckman Coulter Representative.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
